59 enum LpResult {
60  SOLUTION_FOUND,
61  UNBOUNDED_SOLUTION,
62  NO_SOLUTION,
63  LINEARLY_DEPENDENT

285 template <typename Real>
286 void simp1(const Real *const tableau, const int n, const int mm,
287  const int *const ll, const int nll, const bool use_abs,
288  int &kp, Real &bmax);

291 void simp2(const Real *const tableau, const int m, const int n, int &ip,
292  const int kp, const Real eps);

298 
347 template <typename Real>
348 int simplex(Real *const tableau, const int m, const int n, const int m1,
349  const int m2, int *const izrov, int *const iposv, const Real eps)
350 {
351  const int m3 = m - m1 - m2;
352 
353  // Declare other variables
354  Real bmax;
355  int l1[n], nl1, kp, ip, i, j, is;
356  bool need_exchange;
357 
358  // Initialize the list of columns admissible for exchange and make all
359  // variables right-hand
360  nl1 = n;
361  for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
362  l1[i] = i;
363  izrov[i] = i;
364  }
365 
366  // Initial left hand variables
367  for (i = 0; i < m; ++i)
368  iposv[i] = n+i;
369 
370  // PHASE 1:
371  // Use auxiliary objective function to compute initial solution, if there
372  // are no >= or = constraints then the origin is an initial solution
373  if (m2 + m3 != 0) {
374  // Initialize the list of m2 constraints whose slack variables have
375  // never been exchanged out of the initial basis
376  int l3[m2], kh;
377  for (i = 0; i < m2; ++i)
378  l3[i] = 1;
379 
380  // Compute the auxiliary objective function
381  Real* a = &tableau[(m+1)*(n+1)]; // a points to row (m+1)
382  std::fill(a, a+(n+1), static_cast<Real>(0));
383  for (i = m1+1; i < m+1; ++i)
384  for (j = 0; j < n+1; ++j)
385  a[j] -= tableau[i*(n+1)+j];
386 
387  // Use simplex algorithm on auxiliary objective function
388  while (true) {
389  simp1(tableau, n, m+1, l1, nl1, false, kp, bmax);
390 
391  // If auxiliary function is negative and can't be improved then no
392  // feasible solution exists
393  if (bmax <= eps && a[0] <= -eps)
394  return -1;
395 
396  // If auxiliary function is zero and can't be improved then we have
397  // a feasible starting vector
398  if (bmax <= eps && a[0] <= eps) {
399  need_exchange = false;
400  for (ip = m1+m2; ip < m; ++ip) {
401  if (iposv[ip] == n+ip) {
402  simp1(tableau, n, ip, l1, nl1, true, kp, bmax);
403  if (bmax > eps) {
404  need_exchange = true;
405  break;
406  }
407  }
408  }
409 
410  if (!need_exchange) {
411  // Change sign of row for any m2 constraints still present
412  // from the initial basis
413  a = &tableau[(n+1)*(m1+1)];
414  for (i = m1; i < m1+m2; ++i, a += (n+1)) {
415  if (l3[i-m1] == 1) {
416  for (j = 0; j < n+1; ++j)
417  a[j] = -a[j];
418  }
419  }
420 
421  // Go to PHASE 2
422  break;
423  }
424  } else {
425  // Locate the pivot element row
426  simp2(tableau, m, n, ip, kp, eps);
427 
428  // Check to see if the auxiliary objective function is
429  // unbounded, if so then no feasible solution exists
430  if (ip == -1)
431  return -1;
432  }
433 
434  // Exchange a left- and a right-hand variable (phase one), then
435  // update the lists
436  simp3(tableau, n, m+1, n, ip, kp);
437 
438  if (iposv[ip] >= n + m1 + m2) {
439  for (j = 0; j < nl1; ++j) {
440  if (l1[j] == kp) break;
441  }
442 
443  nl1--;
444  for (is = j; is < nl1; ++is)
445  l1[is] = l1[is+1];
446  } else {
447  kh = iposv[ip] - m1 - n;
448  if (kh >= 0 && l3[kh] != 0) {
449  l3[kh] = 0;
450  a[kp+1]++;
451  a = &tableau[0];
452  for (i = 0; i < m+2; ++i, a += (n+1))
453  a[kp+1] = -a[kp+1];
454  a -= (n+1); // reset a to point to row (m+1)
455  }
456  }
457 
458  is = izrov[kp];
459  izrov[kp] = iposv[ip];
460  iposv[ip] = is;
461  } // while (true)
462  } // if (m2 + m3 != 0)
463 
464  // PHASE 2:
465  // Found initial feasible solution, now optimize it
466  while (true) {
467  // Test z-row for doneness
468  simp1(tableau, n, 0, l1, nl1, false, kp, bmax);
469 
470  if (bmax <= eps)
471  return 0;
472 
473  // Locate a pivot element (phase two)
474  simp2(tableau, m, n, ip, kp, eps);
475 
476  // Check for unbounded objective function
477  if (ip == -1)
478  return 1;
479 
480  // Exchange a left- and a right-hand variable (phase two) and update
481  // lists
482  simp3(tableau, n, m, n, ip, kp);
483 
484  is = izrov[kp];
485  izrov[kp] = iposv[ip];
486  iposv[ip] = is;
487  }
488 
489 } // simplex
490 
496 template <typename Real>
497 void simp1(const Real *const tableau, const int n, const int mm,
498  const int *const ll, const int nll, const bool use_abs,
499  int &kp, Real &bmax)
500 {
501  // Only need to access row mm of the tableau
502  const Real *const a = &tableau[mm*(n+1)];
503  Real test;
504 
505  if (nll <= 0) {
506  bmax = static_cast<Real>(0);
507  } else {
508  kp = ll[0];
509  bmax = a[kp+1];
510 
511  for (int k = 1; k < nll; ++k) {
512  if (use_abs)
513  test = std::abs(a[ll[k]+1]) - std::abs(bmax);
514  else
515  test = a[ll[k]+1] - bmax;
516 
517  if (test > 0) {
518  kp = ll[k];
519  bmax = a[kp+1];
520  }
521  }
522  }
523 } // simp1
524 
529 template <typename Real>
530 void simp2(const Real *const tableau, const int m, const int n, int &ip,
531  const int kp, const Real eps)
532 {
533  Real q, q0, q1, qp;
534 
535  int i;
536  const Real* a = &tableau[(n+1)];
537  for (i = 0; i < m; ++i, a += (n+1))
538  if (a[kp+1] < -eps) break;
539 
540  // If there are no possible pivots, return
541  if (i == m) {
542  ip = -1;
543  return;
544  }
545 
546  q1 = -a[0] / a[kp+1];
547  ip = i;
548 
549  a = &tableau[(n+1)*(ip+2)];
550  for (i = ip+1; i < m; ++i, a += (n+1)) {
551  if (a[kp+1] < -eps) {
552  q = -a[0]/a[kp+1];
553  if (q < q1) {
554  ip = i;
555  q1 = q;
556  } else if (q == q1) {
557  const Real* ap = &tableau[(n+1)*(ip+1)];
558  for (int j = 0; j < n; ++j) {
559  qp = -ap[j+1] / ap[kp+1];
560  q0 = -a[j+1] / a[kp+1];
561  if (q0 != qp) break;
562  }
563  if (q0 < qp) ip = i;
564  }
565  }
566  }
567 } // simp2
568 
572 template <typename Real>
573 void simp3(Real *const tableau, const int n, const int i1, const int k1,
574  const int ip, const int kp)
575 {
576  Real piv = static_cast<Real>(1) / tableau[(ip+1)*(n+1)+kp+1];
577 
578  // Update all elements except pivot row
579  Real* a = &tableau[0];
580  for (int i = 0; i < i1+1; ++i, a += (n+1)) {
581  if (i != ip+1) {
582  // Pivot column
583  a[kp+1] *= piv;
584 
585  // Non-pivot column
586  for (int j = 0; j < k1+1; ++j) {
587  if (j != kp+1)
588  a[j] -= tableau[(ip+1)*(n+1)+j] * a[kp+1];
589  }
590  }
591  }
592 
593  // Update the pivot row
594  a = &tableau[(ip+1)*(n+1)];
595  for (int j = 0; j < k1+1; ++j) {
596  if (j != kp+1)
597  a[j] *= -piv;
598  }
599 
600  // Update the pivot element
601  a[kp+1] = piv;
602 } // simp3
603 
604  } // namespace Numerics
605 } // namespace Mutation
606 
607 #endif // NUMERICS_LP_H
608 
609 /*
610 
611 The following list of tableau updates corresponds to the simplex method used on
612 the following linear programming problem:
613 
614 maximize z = x1 + x2 + 3*x3 - 0.5*x4 for xi >= 0 and
615 
616 x1 + 2*x3 <= 740
617  2*x2 - 7*x4 <= 0
618  x2 - x3 + 2*x4 >= 0.5
619 x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 = 9
620 
621 
622 Initial tableau:
623 ================
624 
625  x1 x2 x3 x4 y1 y2 y3
626  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
627  z | 0.00 1.00 1.00 3.00 -0.50 0.00 0.00 0.00
628 z1 | 740.00 -1.00 0.00 -2.00 0.00 -1.00 0.00 0.00
629 z2 | 0.00 0.00 -2.00 0.00 7.00 0.00 -1.00 0.00
630 z3 | 0.50 0.00 -1.00 1.00 -2.00 0.00 0.00 1.00
631 z4 | 9.00 -1.00 -1.00 -1.00 -1.00 0.00 0.00 0.00
632 z' | -749.50 2.00 4.00 2.00 -4.00 1.00 1.00 -1.00
633 
634 
635 PHASE 1:
636 ========
637 
638  x1 z2 x3 x4 y1 y2 y3
639  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
640  z | 0.00 1.00 -0.50 3.00 3.00 0.00 -0.50 0.00
641 z1 | 740.00 -1.00 -0.00 -2.00 0.00 -1.00 0.00 0.00
642 x2 | 0.00 0.00 -0.50 0.00 3.50 0.00 -0.50 0.00
643 z3 | 0.50 0.00 0.50 1.00 -5.50 0.00 0.50 1.00
644 z4 | 9.00 -1.00 0.50 -1.00 -4.50 0.00 0.50 0.00
645 z' | -749.50 2.00 -2.00 2.00 10.00 1.00 -1.00 -1.00
646 
647  x1 z2 x3 z3 y1 y2 y3
648  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
649  z | 0.27 1.00 -0.23 3.55 -0.55 0.00 -0.23 0.55
650 z1 | 740.00 -1.00 0.00 -2.00 -0.00 -1.00 0.00 0.00
651 x2 | 0.32 0.00 -0.18 0.64 -0.64 0.00 -0.18 0.64
652 x4 | 0.09 0.00 0.09 0.18 -0.18 0.00 0.09 0.18
653 z4 | 8.59 -1.00 0.09 -1.82 0.82 0.00 0.09 -0.82
654 z' | -748.59 2.00 -1.09 3.82 -1.82 1.00 -0.09 0.82
655 
656  x1 z2 z4 z3 y1 y2 y3
657  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
658  z | 17.02 -0.95 -0.05 -1.95 1.05 0.00 -0.05 -1.05
659 z1 | 730.55 0.10 -0.10 1.10 -0.90 -1.00 -0.10 0.90
660 x2 | 3.32 -0.35 -0.15 -0.35 -0.35 0.00 -0.15 0.35
661 x4 | 0.95 -0.10 0.10 -0.10 -0.10 0.00 0.10 0.10
662 x3 | 4.72 -0.55 0.05 -0.55 0.45 0.00 0.05 -0.45
663 z' | -730.55 -0.10 -0.90 -2.10 -0.10 1.00 0.10 -0.90
664 
665  x1 z2 z4 z3 z1 y2 y3
666  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
667  z | 17.02 -0.95 -0.05 -1.95 1.05 -0.00 -0.05 -1.05
668 y1 | 730.55 0.10 -0.10 1.10 -0.90 -1.00 -0.10 0.90
669 x2 | 3.32 -0.35 -0.15 -0.35 -0.35 -0.00 -0.15 0.35
670 x4 | 0.95 -0.10 0.10 -0.10 -0.10 -0.00 0.10 0.10
671 x3 | 4.72 -0.55 0.05 -0.55 0.45 -0.00 0.05 -0.45
672 z' | -0.00 0.00 -1.00 -1.00 -1.00 -1.00 0.00 0.00
673 
674 
675 PHASE 2:
676 ========
677 
678  x1 y2 y3
679  ------------------------------------
680  z | 17.02 -0.95 -0.05 -1.05
681 y1 | 730.55 0.10 -0.10 0.90
682 x2 | 3.32 -0.35 -0.15 0.35
683 x4 | 0.95 -0.10 0.10 0.10
684 x3 | 4.72 -0.55 0.05 -0.45
685 z' | -0.00 0.00 0.00 0.00
686 
687 z cannot be maximized any more so the solution is given as
688 
689 x1 = 0.00
690 x2 = 3.32
691 x3 = 4.72
692 x4 = 0.95
693 
694 and the max(z) = 17.02
695 
696 */
Mutation::Numerics::simp2

Definition: lp.h:530
